availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George T. Blakey (Logan County, farmer and sheriff)

body.p: Logan County, Kentucky, farmer and sheriff. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah E. McClean Blakey on February 14, 1844. Father of Susan Blakey, William Blakey, George D. Blakey, and Mary L. Blakey. Farmer in Logan County in 1850. Farmer in Logan County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Logan County in 1850. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Logan County in 1860. Sheriff in Logan County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, District 2, p. 130A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, District 2, p. 26.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, District 2, p. 20.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, District 2, p. 4-5.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, Gordonsville, p. 19.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 000364550, p. 308.
Find A Grave, "George Thomas Blakey (1822-1914)," Memorial #95467766, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/95467766 (accessed December 3, 2018).
